Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 regarding street lighting within your authority. I want to request the following information:
1. The total number of street lighting units (including lamps, columns, or other devices used for illuminating public roads, pathways, and communal areas) currently managed by your authority.
2. The total duration (in hours) that the street lighting units are illuminated each day. If the operating schedule changes monthly or seasonally, please provide details for each period (e.g., each month or season) broken down by region, ward, or district.
If it is not possible to provide the information requested in its entirety, I would be grateful if you could supply as much data as possible, explaining any limitations.
Thanks,
Jamie Dixon

Dear Jamie Dixon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to street lighting
numbers & duration which we received on 20/09/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 18/10/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Jamie Dixon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to street lighting
numbers & duration which we received on 20/09/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The total number of street lighting units (including lamps, columns, or
other devices used for illuminating public roads, pathways, and communal
areas) currently managed by your authority.
Total number of Street lighting units managed by Amey on the highway
network is 66,336.
2. The total duration (in hours) that the street lighting units are
illuminated each day. If the operating schedule changes monthly or
seasonally, please provide details for each period (e.g., each month or
season) broken down by region, ward, or district.
Each Street lighting unit burns for 4,125 hours per annum, switching on at
dawn and off at dusk (this figure includes part night dimming for the
whole of the Sheffield highway network). This figure is an approximation
as it is impossible to state exactly because on dark days during winter,
they will come on earlier according to the lux levels.  The same applies
in summer when, on sunny bright evenings, they will come on later.  This
is the same across all Ward/District areas.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...

Kind Regards,
